title: Serbo-Croatian
summary: Serbo-Croatian (/ˌsɜːrboʊkroʊˈeɪʃən/ (listen))[8][9] – also called Serbo-Croat (/ˌsɜːrboʊˈkroʊæt/),[8][9] Serbo-Croat-Bosnian (SCB),[10] Bosnian-Croatian-Serbian (BCS),[11] and Bosnian-Croatian-Montenegrin-Serbian (BCMS)[12] – is a South Slavic language and the primary language of Serbia, Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, and Montenegro. It is a pluricentric language with four[13] mutually intelligible standard varieties, namely Serbian, Croatian, Bosnian, and Montenegrin.[14][15]
